clinical_study.brief_title: Multicenter Intervention Program to Optimize the Clinical Management of Community-acquired Pneumonia in Hospitals
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Intervention Program to Optimize the Clinical Management of Community-acquired Pneumonia in Hospitals

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación Pública Andaluza Progreso y Salud

clinical_study.source: Andalusian Initiative for Advanced Therapies - Fundación Pública Andaluza Progreso y Salud

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the impact of a structured package (bundle) in reducing the use of antimicrobials and hospital stay of patients with community-acquired pneumonia (CAP), and no increase in mortality of these patients in different hospitals.

primary_outcome.measure: Antimicrobial use in patients hospitalized for CAP.
primary_outcome.description: It is measured in defined daily doses (DDD) per 100 hospital stay of patients hospitalized with CAP.
Number of death of patients hospitalized with CAP, stratified by CURB-65 score.

secondary_outcome.measure: CAP severity CURB-65 or PSI registered.
secondary_outcome.description: Implementation of quality indicators in the management of CAP. They are expressed as dichotomous variables (yes / no): Numbers of doctors who register on the clinical history the evaluation of CAP severity by CURB-65 or PSI at hospitalization.

Implementation of quality indicators in the management of CAP. They are expressed as dichotomous variables (yes / no): Numbers of doctors who taking all microbiological samples recommended in the guideline in the first 6 hours of patient admission.

Implementation of quality indicators in the management of CAP. They are expressed as dichotomous variables (yes / no): Number of doctors who take supportive treatment according to guideline during the hospitalization.

Implementation of quality indicators in the management of CAP. They are expressed as dichotomous variables (yes / no): Number of doctors who prescribed empirical treatment according to the guideline at admission.
Implementation of quality indicators in the management of CAP. They are expressed as dichotomous variables (yes / no): Number of doctors who switch to oral therapy according to guideline.

Implementation of quality indicators in the management of CAP. They are expressed as dichotomous variables (yes / no): Number of doctors who prescribed the specific antimicrobial treatment defined in the guideline

Implementation of quality indicators in the management of CAP. They are expressed as dichotomous variables (yes / no): Number of doctors who prescribe an antimicrobial treatment during 7 days or less, or 5 days or less after clinical improvement.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pre-intervention All patients admitted with a diagnosis of CAP
Post intervention All patient admitted with a diagnosis of CAP

study_pop.textblock:
Pre-intervention period
All patients admitted with a diagnosis of CAP will be included in the participating centers during the 12 months prior to the intervention. Case detection is done through the electronic record of the basic minimum data set (MDS) (2, 36). Diagnosed patients will be selected at discharge: "simple acute bronchitis and pneumonia excluding asthma major criteria" (by diagnosis related group, DRG 541) and "simple and pleuritis in over 17 Pneumonia" (DRG 089).
Post-intervention period
All patients admitted with a diagnosis of CAP in the participating centers, which measures the bundle will apply prospectively included. Case detection was performed by daily review of patients admitted to target units and will be coordinated by the IP address of each center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of CAP at hospital admission .
- Age: 18 years or more.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with nosocomial pneumonia or criteria related to health care.
- Patients with severe immunosuppression (HIV infection with <200 CD4+ lymphocytes / mm3), neutropenia (<500 neutrophils / mm3).
- Patient treated with immunosuppressive drugs.
